title: Bengaluru stampede: KSCA top officials resign; take moral responsibility for 11 deaths
content: Following the tragic stampede at Bengaluru's M Chinnaswamy Stadium, which resulted in multiple fatalities and injuries, KSCA Secretary A Shankar and Treasurer A E Jairam have resigned. They cited moral responsibility for the incident amid public outcry and an ongoing investigation into crowd management failures during IPL victory celebrations. An FIR has been filed, and the officials sought anticipatory bail.

title: 'It could have gone nuclear': Trump again claims he 'stopped India-Pakistan war'
content: Donald Trump has reiterated his claim that his intervention prevented a potential nuclear war between India and Pakistan, asserting he used trade leverage to halt hostilities. This assertion received unexpected support from Russia, with a Putin aide confirming Trump's role. However, Indian officials have pushed back against the mediation claims, directly addressing concerns with US Vice President JD Vance.

title: Watch: Is Trump worried about Elon Musk using drugs? Here is what he said
content: The alliance between Donald Trump and Elon Musk has dissolved into a public feud, marked by accusations and rebuttals. Trump addressed concerns about Musk's alleged drug use and the fairness of government subsidies to Tesla. This fallout follows Musk's criticism of Trump's bill, leading to market instability for Tesla and a potential disposal of Trump's Tesla car.

title: Jafrabad double murder: 55 days on, chargesheet names 13
content: Bengal police filed a charge sheet regarding the Murshidabad violence. The violence resulted in the deaths of Harogobindo Das and his son Chandan. A rumour about a mosque attack triggered the incident. Police arrested thirteen individuals from Bengal, Odisha, and Jharkhand. The accused face charges including murder and armed robbery. The Das family seeks a CBI probe.

title: 'Out of Soros’ playbook': BJP slams Rahul over Maha polls 'rigged' claim
content: Amit Malviya has strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi's allegations of election rigging in Maharashtra, dismissing them as a tactic inspired by George Soros to undermine public trust in institutions. Malviya highlighted the inconsistency in Gandhi's claims, noting the absence of similar concerns when Congress secured victories in Telangana and Karnataka.

title: Google's next CEO: Sundar Pichai says, 'Whoever is running it will have ...
content: Sundar Pichai envisions a future Google CEO empowered by an extraordinary AI companion, reflecting the company's deep AI integration. He emphasizes AI as a tool to amplify human productivity, not replace workers, citing his own experimentation with AI coding assistants. Google prepares for a future where AI and human executives collaborate closely, reshaping leadership and work.

title: IND vs ENG: Ponting backs Gill as Test captain, suggests ideal batting spot
content: Ricky Ponting believes Shubman Gill's captaincy is a smart move for India's Test team as they transition post-Rohit and Kohli. He suggests Gill batting at No.4 could ease pressure, with Jaiswal and Sudharsan opening. Ponting is optimistic about India's young talent and advocates for Arshdeep Singh's inclusion in the first Test, citing his skills and suitability to the Dukes ball.

title: ‘No longer any question': Trump says Xi agreed to let rare earth minerals flow to US
content: President Xi Jinping has reportedly agreed to resume rare earth mineral and magnet exports to the US, potentially easing trade tensions. This follows a positive phone conversation between Trump and Xi, with temporary export permits already issued to suppliers serving major US automakers.

title: Too many emails? Google AI CEO says he’d pay big to get rid of them: ‘The thing…'
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis is developing an AI-powered email system to alleviate the burden of inbox management. Hassabis expressed his desire to eliminate emails, even at a high cost, and his team is actively creating a tool that sorts, replies, and ensures important messages are addressed.

title: Mithi river scam: ED summons actor Dino Morea for questioning next week in fraud case
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned Bollywood actor Dino Morea for questioning next week in connection with the alleged ₹65 crore Mithi River desilting scam. This action follows ED raids at fifteen locations, including Morea's Mumbai residence, under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA).

title: 'You take silly point!': Rohit and Pujara relive fielding fights - Watch
content: At Puja Pujara's book launch, cricketers Rohit Sharma and Cheteshwar Pujara entertained the audience with humorous anecdotes from their playing days. They reminisced about their playful arguments over fielding positions like short leg and silly point, with Pujara initially using his batting position - No.3 - as an excuse to avoid them.

title: Extreme poverty in India sees sharp decline! Number dips from 344.47m to 75.24m
content: A recent World Bank report indicates a significant decline in extreme poverty in India, dropping from 27.1% to 5.3% between 2011-12 and 2022-23. Approximately 269 million people escaped extreme poverty during this period. The assessment, using a stricter $3 daily consumption benchmark, highlights substantial progress.

title: Did Gates cost Microsoft $400 bn? Ex-CEO seems to share Android co-founder’s view: ‘We were too…’
content: Former Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer acknowledged that overconfidence in Windows led to the company's failure in the smartphone market. He admitted Microsoft tried forcing Windows into unsuitable areas like mobile and automotive, resulting in poor user experiences.

title: 'Stopped for tea break': Tejashwi escapes unhurt after convoy hit by truck in Bihar
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav narrowly escaped injury early Saturday when a speeding truck collided with two vehicles in his convoy in Vaishali district, Bihar. The incident, which occurred around 12:30 am near Goraul on the Patna-Muzaffarpur highway, left three security personnel injured. Yadav, who was returning to Patna from Madhepura, visited the injured at the hospital.

title: Meerut horror: Mother kills teen daughter over affair; cuts off head using bolt cutter
content: In a shocking incident in Meerut, a 17-year-old girl's headless body was discovered in a canal, leading to the arrest of her mother and four relatives. Aastha was allegedly strangled and beheaded for having a relationship, with her family attempting to conceal the crime by disposing of the body parts in different canals.

title: Delhi airport runway shutdown: 3 month closure may impact 200 flights daily
content: Indira Gandhi International Airport will experience flight disruptions from June 15 to September 15 due to runway 10/28's closure for CAT-IIIB compliance upgrades. While 114 daily flights will be cancelled, 86 are being rescheduled, potentially impacting around 200 flights daily.

title: 'Golden doors, throne': Ayodhya Ram temple uses 45kg of pure gold worth Rs 50cr
content: The Ram Temple in Ayodhya has been adorned with 45 kilograms of pure gold, valued at approximately Rs 50 crore, as confirmed by Nripendra Mishra. This gold has been used in the temple's doors and Lord Ram's throne. While the main structure is complete, other facilities are still under construction and are expected to be completed by December 2025.

title: 'Among 2025’s biggest losses': Tesla stock crash wipes out $380bn! Trump-Musk rift hits hard
content: Tesla's shares plummeted following a public feud between Elon Musk and Donald Trump, triggered by Musk's criticism of Trump's tax bill. This clash exacerbated existing challenges, making Tesla the worst-performing large-cap stock this year. Despite a slight rebound, the fallout raises concerns about Tesla's future amid political and regulatory uncertainty, impacting investor confidence.

title: Bengaluru stampede: 'CMO instructed to proceed despite risks,' cops say seniors made scapegoats
content: The suspension of Bengaluru's police commissioner and other officers over IPL victory celebrations has sparked outrage within the police force. Many officers feel betrayed, alleging the government orchestrated the event despite risks. They claim the commissioner initially opposed the Vidhana Soudha venue, but was overruled by the Chief Minister's office, leading to them being scapegoated for following orders.

title: AP Inter Supply Result: How to check 1st, 2nd yr Supplementary, Betterment results
content: The Board of Intermediate Education Andhra Pradesh (BIEAP) has declared the AP Inter Supplementary and Betterment Results 2025. Students who appeared in the exams held from May 12 to May 20 can now check their subject-wise marks online at resultsbie.ap.gov.in using their hall ticket number. Successful candidates can proceed with college admissions, while those who did not clear all subjects will get another chance in the upcoming supplementary exams announced soon.

title: Smoke bombs, protests, arrests: Tensions soar in Los Angeles after ICE raids
content: Immigration sweeps by ICE agents in Los Angeles, including at Home Depot locations, sparked widespread protests and a tense standoff. Demonstrators rallied against the enforcement actions, leading to over 40 arrests and clashes with law enforcement. The protests intensified after the arrest of SEIU California President David Huerta, who was accused of obstructing federal agents.

title: 75+ messages, greetings, wishes and quotes for Eid-ul-Adha 2025
content: Eid ul-Adha, a significant day for Muslims globally, commemorates Prophet Ibrahim's devotion and is celebrated with prayers, gratitude, and charitable giving. Families honor the occasion by sacrificing an animal and sharing it with loved ones and those in need.

title: Bengaluru stampede: KSCA secretary, treasurer resign; RCB parent company remains tight lipped
content: Following a tragic stampede outside M Chinnaswamy Stadium that resulted in 11 deaths, Karnataka State Cricket Association (KSCA) secretary A Shankar and treasurer ES Jairam have resigned. The incident occurred after Royal Challengers Bengaluru's (RCB) IPL victory, with lakhs gathering despite inadequate planning.

title: 'Chenab & Anji Bridge are transformative projects': PM Modi hails infra push in J&K - Watch
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi recently visited Jammu and Kashmir, inaugurating the Chenab Rail Bridge, the world's highest railway bridge, and flagging off the Katra-Srinagar Vande Bharat train. The bridge, a symbol of engineering prowess and resilience, ensures year-round rail connectivity to the Kashmir Valley. Modi also interacted with engineers and workers, acknowledging their efforts in overcoming construction challenges.

title: TOI Exclusive: 'Winning means more than stats' - Sudharsan ready for test in England
content: Ahead of the England Tests, Sai Sudharsan emphasises team contribution over personal milestones, aiming to enhance his batting across formats. Fresh off a successful IPL season with Gujarat Titans, he's focused on adapting to Test cricket's demands. Sudharsan values his partnership with Shubman Gill, learning from his calm mindset and tactical acumen.

title: IND vs ENG: No more musical chairs! For KL Rahul, England could finally be home
content: KL Rahul, known for his adaptability and resilience, faces a significant opportunity in the upcoming England series. With senior players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma absent, Rahul emerges as the most experienced Indian batter on English soil. His childhood coach emphasises his mental fortitude and technical foundation built on red-ball cricket, expecting a matured performance.

title: 400 drones, 40 missiles: Footage shows Russia's attacks on Ukraine; watch video
content: Russia launched a massive aerial assault on Ukraine, deploying over 400 drones and 40 missiles, resulting in casualties and widespread damage across six regions. The attack, which killed at least six and injured around 80, targeted residential areas and critical infrastructure, prompting condemnation from President Zelenskyy.

title: Smiles, shades and a new era: Team India arrives in England for Test series - Watch
content: Team India has landed in England, commencing their preparations for the five-Test series, which marks the beginning of the 2025-27 WTC cycle. This series signifies a new era following the retirements of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. Shubman Gill leads the team, with the first Test scheduled for June 20.

title: Watch: Rohit shares unknown story of Pujara from 2012 during event
content: At Puja Pujara's book launch, Rohit Sharma shared a humorous anecdote from a 2012 West Indies tour, recalling how Cheteshwar Pujara was mobbed after venturing out late for vegetarian food. Sharma also lauded Pujara's resilience in overcoming ACL injuries to play over 100 Tests.

title: Navy set to induct 1st of 16 desi shallow water craft on June 18
content: The Indian Navy is preparing to commission INS Arnala, the first of 16 anti-submarine warfare shallow watercraft, on June 18th in Visakhapatnam. Built by GRSE and L&T Shipbuilders, this 77-meter warship features over 80% indigenous content and advanced underwater sensors. These warships are being built at Indian shipyards at an overall cost of Rs 12,622 crore.

title: From YouTubers to spies: ISI’s new playbook
content: Punjab Police suspect Pakistan's ISI is using Indian YouTubers for espionage, arresting Jasbir Singh, who has 11 lakh subscribers, for allegedly sharing sensitive information. This follows the arrest of YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra and several others, including a cobbler and tailor, indicating a broader ISI strategy to gather intelligence and potentially influence public opinion through online personalities with wide reach

title: Mother Teresa Women’s University results; UG, PG scores out; how to check
content: Mother Teresa Women's University, Kodaikanal, has released the semester results for various UG and PG programmes. Students can check their results online via the official website by entering their register number under the "Results" section. The university advises students to verify all details and contact the Controller of Examinations in case of discrepancies. Original mark sheets will be issued later. For further updates and notifications, students are encouraged to visit the university website regularly.

title: 'Not a positive memory': Carlsen haunted by Gukesh loss; but says 'Indians need time'
content: Magnus Carlsen clinched his seventh Norway Chess title, benefiting from D Gukesh's final-round loss to Fabiano Caruana. Carlsen drew his last game, securing the win with 16 points, while Caruana finished second. Carlsen acknowledged the potential of young Indian talents like Gukesh and Arjun Erigaisi, highlighting his own challenging tournament, including a notable loss to Gukesh.

title: 'The America Party': Amid spat with Trump, is Musk eyeing third front?
content: A public fallout has occurred between Donald Trump and Elon Musk, once allies. Musk proposed "The America Party" after a poll on X, fueled by his vision to dismantle the establishment. The rift escalated after Musk criticized Trump's legislative efforts, leading to Trump threatening to terminate Musk's government subsidies and contracts.

title: WTC Final: Jansen reveals Ponting's cheeky send-off - 'Good luck, but ...'
content: Marco Jansen revealed Ricky Ponting's playful parting words as he gears up for the World Test Championship Final against Australia. Jansen, fresh from a successful IPL season, valued Ponting's positive coaching approach. He also looks forward to learning from Stuart Broad, who joined the Proteas as a consultant, to gain insights on facing the Australian team at Lord's.

title: 'Should do all it can': US lawmaker tells Pak delegation to eliminate terror groups
content: US Congressman Brad Sherman urged a Pakistani delegation, led by Bilawal Bhutto Zardari, to eliminate Jaish-e-Mohammad and protect religious minorities. Sherman highlighted the murder of his constituent, Daniel Pearl, by the group. He also called for the release of Dr. Shakil Afridi, imprisoned for aiding in Osama bin Laden's killing.

title: NBA fans react as Brady leaves James off GOAT list; Clark, Reese make cut
content: Tom Brady ignited NBA fan debate by revealing his Mount Rushmore of GOATs, notably including Michael Jordan and Kobe Bryant while omitting LeBron James. The list also featured WNBA stars like Caitlin Clark and A'ja Wilson, alongside athletes from various sports, sparking controversy among fans who questioned the exclusion of James and the inclusion of newer players.

title: In first foreign trip after Operation Sindoor, PM likely to highlight Pak's terror export
content: Following an invitation from Canadian PM Mark Carney, PM Modi has accepted to attend the G7 summit in Alberta. This decision comes after speculation about his participation and amid efforts to mend strained relations following allegations regarding the murder of Hardeep Singh Nijjar.

title: French Open: 'Honoured' Djokovic hints at farewell; loses to Sinner
content: Following his semi-final defeat by Jannik Sinner at Roland Garros, Novak Djokovic hinted at a possible farewell to the Parisian crowd. The 38-year-old, a three-time champion, expressed gratitude for the support he received, stating it might be his last match there.

title: Norway Chess: Gukesh falters in final round; Carlsen clinches 7th title
content: Magnus Carlsen clinched his seventh Norway Chess title after D Gukesh's loss to Fabiano Caruana in the final round. Carlsen secured the championship with 16 points, closely followed by Caruana and Gukesh. In the women's section, Anna Muzychuk of Ukraine emerged victorious, despite losing the Armageddon tie-break, while Koneru Humpy finished as the runner-up.

title: WACE of Australia is 1st foreign government-backed board in India
content: Australia expands its educational presence in India, with Western Australia's WACE becoming the first foreign government-backed school board to gain equivalence for its Class X and XII qualifications in 25 years.

title: Trade war: US-China trade talks next week; Trump says 'meet should go well'
content: US officials, including Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, are set to meet in London for trade negotiations, announced President Trump. This follows a conversation with Chinese President Xi Jinping amidst ongoing trade tensions. Despite recent tariff reductions after Geneva talks, concerns remain.

title: Patient raped in ICU of Rajasthan hospital by nursing staffer
content: In Alwar, a shocking incident occurred at ESIC Medical College where a 32-year-old woman, recovering from a tubectomy in the surgical ICU, was allegedly raped by a nursing staff member. Following the husband's complaint and the woman's disclosure, police have registered a case, and the accused, Subhash Ghithala, has been barred from the hospital.

title: Panthers win epic double-OT Game 2: Grades, big questions for both teams
content: The series is tied heading back to Florida for Game 3. Here's how it all happened, and what comes next.

title: Panthers marvel as Marchand delivers 2OT winner
content: Brad Marchand's second goal of a thrilling Game 2 clinched a 5-4 double-overtime victory for the Panthers, evening the Stanley Cup Final at 1-1.

title: Judge grants final approval to House settlement
content: Schools are now free to begin paying their athletes directly, marking the dawn of a new era in college sports brought about by a multibillion-dollar legal settlement that was formally approved Friday.

title: Texas bests TTU to win first NCAA softball title
content: Texas won its first NCAA softball championship Friday night, beating Texas Tech 10-4 in Game 3 of the Women's College World Series championship series in Oklahoma City.

title: Sources: Knicks interested in speaking with Kidd
content: The New York Knicks are conducting active due diligence on Dallas Mavericks coach Jason Kidd among other head coaching candidates in their search to replace Tom Thibodeau, sources told ESPN.

title: MLB exec to lead new college enforcement arm
content: Major League Baseball executive Bryan Seeley will become the CEO of the new College Sports Commission, a vital enforcement arm that will have final say in doling out punishments and deciding when rules have been broken in the post-House settlement era.

title: Sinner beats Djokovic, advances to French final
content: Top seed Jannik Sinner advanced to the French Open final by defeating No. 6 seed Novak Djokovic 6-4, 7-5, 7-6 (3) in Friday's semifinal.

title: Sandler to cast Ravens' Henry if he rushes for 2K
content: Actor/comedian Adam Sandler has promised to cast Ravens running back Derrick Henry in a future movie if he can reach 2,000 yards rushing next season.

title: Concerned McIlroy misses cut by 12 at Canadian
content: Rory McIlroy tumbled out of the RBC Canadian Open on Friday with his second-highest score to par in any PGA Tour round of his career, with Cameron Champ taking a two-stroke lead into the weekend in the final event before the U.S. Open.

title: 👀 Prospect watch: 2026 NFL draft QB class
content: Will Cade Klubnik, LaNorris Sellers or Drew Allar be QB1 in next year's draft? And who are the other names to know in the class?

title: The incredible never-before-told story of the home run ball that turned Derek Jeter into 'Mr. November'
content: Fistfuls of flying dollars, an alert vendor and a Jeter signature. Here's the tale of one of MLB's most famous artifacts.

title: Who will win the French Open women's title?
content: It's between No. 1 Sabalenka and No. 2 Gauff for the French Open title. Our experts make predictions.

title: Aaron Rodgers to the Steelers -- finally: Grading the move, and whether he's actually an upgrade
content: The Steelers finally landed Rodgers after months of anticipation. But can the move actually improve the offense? Let's grade the signing.

title: 'I do record everything': The told and untold stories of Merab Dvalishvili
content: Merab Dvalishvili, the UFC champion Dana White once called "next-level stupid," is slowly taking over the internet.

title: USMNT depth chart: Top 15 at each position entering Gold Cup
content: Where does the USMNT roster stand entering the Gold Cup? Here are the top 15 players at each position.

title: 'The Game 1 collapse was insane': What led the Knicks to fire Tom Thibodeau
content: Despite back-to-back 50-win seasons, whispers about Tom Thibodeau's future in New York had percolated for months.

title: Pro softball is on deck! What to know about the inaugural AUSL season
content: The league will feature four teams and a touring model that will serve as a "tryout" for prospective home cities next season.

title: Why film study is so important to young NFL QBs like the Bears' Caleb Williams
content: Not only did the Bears hire an offensive-minded head coach in Ben Johnson, but they signed Case Keenum to mentor Williams.

title: 2025 Mountain West Conference preview: Can Boise State do it again?
content: The Broncos, the Group of 5 standard-bearer, reached the CFP. They might be MWC favorites, but others in the league made big moves.

title: PLL Week 2 preview: Everything you need to know for Chaos homecoming
content: The PLL heads to Charlotte for four games. Check here for the full schedule, key stats, injury notes and more.

title: Poch: New-look USMNT must 'fight for place' at WC
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino said it's important to focus on the opportunity for his young squad, rather than the absences of several senior players.

title: Spurs fire Postecoglou despite Europa League win
content: Tottenham Hotspur sacked head coach Ange Postecoglou on Friday after deciding a change was necessary for the club "to compete on multiple fronts."

title: Portugal's Neves: NL final not Ronaldo vs. Yamal
content: Portugal midfielder João Neves says Sunday's UEFA Nations League final is not just Lamine Yamal against Cristiano Ronaldo.

title: LaLiga: Barça's Raphinha POY, Yamal Best U23
content: Barcelona winger Raphinha was named LaLiga Player of the Season on Friday, after the Brazilian played a major role in his side winning the domestic treble, with club teammate Lamine Yamal named Best Under-23 player.

title: Matic, Hassan banned for hiding anti-LGBTQ+ sign
content: Lyon's Nemanja Matic and Le Havre's Ahmed Hassan have been handed two-game bans after they concealed Ligue 1's anti-homophobia sign on their shirts.

title: Source: USWNT's Fishel in talks with NWSL clubs
content: United States women's national team forward Mia Fishel is in discussions with multiple NWSL teams about a summer transfer away from Chelsea, a source with knowledge of the situation told ESPN.

title: Man United reveal financial boost despite PL woes
content: Manchester United raised their annual core profit forecast on Friday as the club's strong performance in the Europa League drove ticket sales and broadcast revenue.

title: ⚽ Top 100 men's soccer players in the world
content: It's that time again: with the UEFA Champions League final behind us and the 2024-25 season officially over, it's time to rank the top 100 players in the world of men's soccer right now. Welcome to the FC 100.

title: Ronaldo throwback? Real Madrid launch new home kit for CWC
content: Real Madrid's new home kit is similar to 2009-10, pays homage to the Bernabeu stadium and will be worn at this summer's Club World Cup.

title: How members of the Pasadena Run Club are finding salvation in a post-wildfire world
content: Though still reeling from the Eaton fire, a group of L.A. area runners are determined to build a worthwhile future.

title: Ranking every WNBA team's roster core, 1-13: Which team has the best young players?
content: Let's stack every WNBA team's core by the youth of its roster, leading off with the Fever and Caitlin Clark.

title: Power Rankings: Dream ride four-game winning streak to move up in Week 3 edition
content: Las Vegas, Washington and Chicago join Atlanta as risers as the league begins Commissioner's Cup play.

title: Plucked from Dunkin', QB J'Mar Smith leads the Stallions into the playoffs
content: Smith, a former Stallions signal-caller, had given up on football before a string of injuries brought about his return.

title: Buzz: What will Aaron Rodgers' arrival mean for Steelers' skill players?
content: Aaron Rodgers is headed to the Steelers, but expectations of a return to fantasy greatness should be tempered.

title: Ranking the top 64 NHL draft prospects, including projected ceilings and floors
content: There is no hockey left to be played this season for the top players available June 27-28. Here's how they stack up.

title: Video Shows People Jumping Over Metro Gates On Day Of Deadly Bengaluru Stampede
content: A now-viral video shows thousands of commuters jumping Bengaluru Metro gates at the Majestic interchange.

title: Starlink Plans Yet To Be Out In India, A Look At Pricing In Other Nations
content: Elon Musk's satellite communication company Starlink has received the licence from the Department of Telecommunications (DoT), a key milestone that will take it closer towards launching commercial operations in India.

title: 3 Killed, 22 Injured In Russia's Biggest Attack On Ukraine's Kharkiv
content: One of Ukraine's largest cities, Kharkiv is located just a few dozen kilometres from the Russian border and has been under constant Russian shelling during more than three years of war.

title: Probe Agency ED Summons Actor Dino Morea In Mithi River Scam Day After Raid
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned Bollywood actor Dino Morea and his brother Santino Morea for questioning in connection with an alleged multi-crore scam involving the desilting and cleaning of Mumbai's Mithi River.

title: India 5th Largest Economy, Its Presence "Makes Sense" At G7: Canada PM
content: Mark Carney said that India and Canada are acting on law enforcement, and Prime Minister Narendra Modi has accepted his invitation.

title: Opinion: Opinion | A Commissioner As A Scapegoat For Colossal, Collective Failure?
content: The stampede at the Chinnaswamy Stadium is among the most tragic events I have witnessed in my life as a reporter.

title: Eknath Shinde Stuck At Airport For Hour As Pilot Refuses To Fly After Duty Hours
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's travel from Jalgaon to Mumbai was delayed by nearly an hour on Friday, when the pilot of his aircraft refused to take off, citing the end of his duty hours.

title: "Don't Fight Guys": Ex-Russia President To Trump, Musk. Tesla CEO Responds
content: The friction between Elon Musk and Donald Trump, the two former allies, began shortly after the Tesla CEO criticised the US President's marquee tax bill.

title: "People Have Spoken": Musk After X Poll On New Party Amid Rift With Trump
content: Tech billionaire Elon Musk has proposed the formation of a new political party in the US amid his ongoing feud with President Donald Trump.

title: Who Is Madhavi Latha, Professor Who Spent 17 Years On Chenab Bridge Project
content: The Chenab Bridge in Jammu and Kashmir is the world's highest railway bridge. It was inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday.

title: Rahul Gandhi Claims "Match-Fixing" In Maharashtra Polls, BJP Responds
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has launched a critique of the November 2024 Maharashtra assembly elections, accusing the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) of orchestrating a "match-fixing" operation to engineer a victory.

title: Narrow Escape For Tejashwi Yadav As Truck Rams RJD Leader's Convoy
content: Leader of Opposition (LoP) in Bihar Assembly, Tejashwi Yadav, had a narrow escape as his convoy met with a major accident while returning from Madhepura to Patna. Three members of his security team sustained injuries in the mishap.

title: "Went Off Cliff Faster Than Tesla": Late-Night Hosts On Trump-Musk Breakup
content: The Trump-Musk break-up sent shockwaves across social media, and late-night television wasted no time in joining the spectacle.

title: "Eliminate Vile Group Jaish": US Lawmaker Warns Bilawal Bhutto-Led Pak Team
content: A senior American lawmaker has told a visiting Pakistani delegation, led by Bilawal Bhutto Zardari, that the country should do "all it can" to eliminate the "vile" terrorist group Jaish-e-Mohammed as well as ensure protection of religious minorities.

title: Days After Teen's Body Found In Suitcase In Bengaluru, 7 Arrested From Bihar
content: On May 21, a torn, blue suitcase was found near the old Chandapura railway bridge in Bengaluru, and its contents were chilling - the body of a 17-year-old girl, Reema.

title: Man Arrested For Giving Death Threat To Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta
content: A 25-year-old man was apprehended on Saturday for allegedly giving a death threat to Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta, police said.

title: "May Not Look, Sound Like Us": Axiom-4 Mission Chief On Extraterrestrial Life
content: Likening a visit to the space station to a camping trip, former NASA astronaut and Axiom-4 mission commander Peggy Whitson said the orbital station as enough food, water and other supplies to sustain the daily lives of those on board.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Two Narcissists Walk Into a Democracy: On The Trump-Musk Saga
content: In ancient Rome, emperors clashed with senators over war and law. In 2025 America, the emperor and the rocket man are feuding over subsidies and social media likes.

title: "May This Festival Inspire Harmony": PM Modi Extends Eid Greetings
content: President Droupadi Murmu and Prime Minister Narendra Modi extended warm wishes to citizens on the occasion of Eid al-Adha or Eid al-Zuha.

title: Extreme Poverty Rate Drops To 5.3% From 27.1% In India: World Bank Report
content: About 75.24 million people were living in extreme poverty in India during 2022-23, a massive drop from 344.47 million in 2011-12.

title: Vick, Iverson ... Keyshawn? Norfolk roots connect Davis to sports legends
content: Michael Vick, Allen Iverson, Pernell Whitaker... and Keyshawn Davis? Meet the newest face in sports to come out of Norfolk, Virginia.

title: Betting the 2025 Belmont Stakes: What you need to know to make a smart race wager
content: From the basics to insider intel, here are betting tips and everything else you need to know for Saturday's Belmont Stakes.

title: Golf odds: Scottie Scheffler the betting favorite in each of the next four majors
content: Odds for next four golf majors: 2025 U.S. Open, Open Championship, 2026 Masters and PGA Championship.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool 'significantly closer' to Wirtz deal
content: Liverpool are approaching reaching Bayer Leverkusen's demands to sign Florian Wirtz. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing? Get the latest every Friday.

title: Indian student scammed in US by imposters who posed as ICE officers
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. title: 10 ways to make your fantasy league more fun
content: more than 13 million people played fantasy football on the ESPN platform last season, organized into approximately 2 million leagues . each league offered something a little different, ranging from redraft to dynasty setups and for the most part, each offered something different . create a league and customize league size, scoring and rules to play in the league you want to play .

title: MLB Power Rankings: Are the Dodgers or Tigers No. 1 this week?
content: the Detroit Tigers have retaken the no. 1 spot and are one of four AL teams in the top 10 in week 10 . the national league is still well-represented at the top of our list . a number of clubs have continued their fall down our rankings this week .

title: Ranking the NFL’s most likely worst-to-first teams
content: 25 teams have gone from worst to first in their division in a single season . the Texans are a recent example . there are clear indicators that help guide us as to which teams are most likely to go from best to first .

title: Juan Soto, the showman, has finally shown up -- is he about to go on a tear?
content: the new york Mets gave him the richest contract in sports history . he won with enthralling walks, commanding attention as much between pitches as during the action . soto shook his head and strutted his hips and he Soto Shuffled .

title: Sources: Man Utd increase offer for Mbeumo
content: Gab Marcotti reacts to Jadon Sancho's decision to return to Man United after his loan at Chelsea. (0:44) Manchester United  have upped their offer for  Brentford  forward  Bryan Mbeumo , sources have told ESPN. United have already seen the offer of an overall package of around £55 million ($74.5m) knocked back by Brentford. Sources have told ESPN that the improved offer is worth more than £60m. United are pushing to get the deal done as quickly as possible. They've already agreed to trigger the £62.5m release clause in  Matheus Cunha 's contract at Wolves. The Brazilian will formally complete his move to Old Trafford after the international break. Mbeumo, who scored 20  Premier League  goals last season, is next on Ruben Amorim's list as he looks to cure his team's goalscoring problems. According to sources, club bosses have been made aware that the 25-year-old favours a move to United despite interest from Newcastle.

title: To succeed at Western Kentucky, Tyson Helton seeks gunslingers
content: western Kentucky head coach Tyson Helton evaluates a quarterback . he says he wants a player completely unaffected by the moment . "there's not one damn great quarterback who don't walk up there like John Wayne," helton says .

title: Barcelona Keep or Dump: What do Yamal & Co. need to build on success?
content: UEFA champions league final takes place at the end of next season . laporta inherited a disastrous financial situation from his predecessor, Josep Maria Bartomeu . barça are still threading the needle to meet laLiga's stringent financial requirements .

content: Sean O'Malley takes on titleholder merab Dvalishvili at uFC 316 on saturday (10 p.m. ET on ESPN PPV) this is O'malley's first fight since the loss . Julianna Pea puts her women's bantamweight title on the line .

title: How Tony Vitello became a Tennessee Orange axe, splitting the college baseball community
content: coach Tony Vitello is coach of the Tennessee Volunteers, the men's college world series champions . he has led the Vols to their fifth consecutive super regional this weekend, as no. 14 Tennessee travels to no. 3 A .

content: Jay Panda said that his delegation that visited four countries that are also members of Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC), which had issued an objectionable statement post the Pahalgam terror attack, which was condemned by India, had received a positive feedback, even on the question of these economic sanctions.

title: 76 army personnel airlifted from landslide-hit Chaten in north Sikkim
content: “The air evacuation operation from Chaten has concluded today with the helicopters transporting army personnel from Chaten to Pakyong Greenfield Airport,” an official said.

content: A Bomb Disposal Squad was rushed to the spot, which safely defused the bombs on the Damodar riverbed,

content: Police recovered 10 country-made pistols, one motorcycle and cartridges from his possession in the Ramraj police station area of the district.

title: Two more persons arrested in crackdown on 'anti-nationals' in Assam
content: One person has been apprehended by Goalpara police for making "offensive social media post on Lord Ram", and another by Kamrup police for "inciting communal discord" through social media.

title: Mithi River desilting: ED summons actor Dino Morea, BMC officials
content: The notices came after the federal probe agency on Friday (June 6, 2025) searched more than 15 premises linked to these people in Mumbai in Maharashtra and Kochi in Kerala.

title: Rectify loopholes at accident spots: Kurnool Collector
content: Kurnool Collector P. Ranjith Basha appreciated the National Highways dept. for responding promptly and undertaking ₹2 crore worth works at the identified black spots to prevent accidents.

content: The Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad Sangma on Saturday said instructions have been given for a fair and impartial inquiry into the incident

content: The accused has been identified as Ashu Korsa of Bijapur in Chhattisgarh in the chargesheet filed before the NIA special court in Jagdalpur on Friday

title: Assam flood situation improves marginally, rivers showing receding trend
content: Flood waters of the Brahmaputra have inundated vast tracts of Kaziranga National Park, the UNESCO World Heritage site, while 70% of the Pobitora Wildlife Sanctuary has been severely affected by the waters of the Brahmaputra and Kopili rivers.

content: The incident took place on Thursday night in Mr. Gupta's residence in Sagar Sanjog building, the Versova police station official said

title: Levy of 30% interest by film financiers not usurious, says Madras High Court
content: Justice P.T. Asha rejects the contention raised by actor Vishal and directs him to pay ₹30.05 crore with 30% interest p.a. from February 2021

title: Lakshadweep MP demands rollback of ship fare hike
content: Muhammed Hamdullah Sayeed writes letter to Lakshadweep administrator Praful Patel and alleges that revision has been imposed without any public consultation, stakeholder engagement, or transparent justification

content: Passengers also described the new service as offering ‘unmatched convenience’ making travel ‘much easier’ and ‘possible and comfortable’.

content: Speeding truck hit his convoy leaving three security personnel injured last night when he was returning from Madhepura, truck driver arrested.

content: The accused, a fraudster who frequently changes his identity is being interrogated in the office of the force's Special Cell in northwest Delhi.

title: Pakistan 'dismayed' over PM Modi's remarks in J&K over Pahalgam terror attack
content: Pakistan said it is dismayed that the Indian Prime Minister has once again chosen to accuse Pakistan of involvement in the Pahalgam attack, without presenting a single piece of credible evidence

title: India, U.S. trade talks extended as deadline looms for interim deal, sources say
content: A U.S. delegation led by senior officials from the USTR held two days of discussions in the national capital with trade officials headed by chief negotiator Rajesh Agrawal, the sources said.

content: Mr. Jagan said he was shocked and pained by the “complete collapse of law and order” under Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu’s governance

title: Germany’s Merz says he found Trump open to dialogue and committed to NATO
content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz says he found President Donald Trump open to discussion and is convinced that Washington remains committed to the NATO alliance

title: West Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari accuses State of ‘suppressing’ fresh Covid data
content: Official Covid bulletins have not been released on the State Health Department website since January 28, 2023

title: Assamese web series spotlights NRC ‘scam’
content: The lead character is based on the man whose petition in the Supreme Court in 2009 led to the exercise of updating the citizens’ list in Assam

title: Kochi shipwreck: A sunken ship and a sea of worries
content: On May 25, a container ship sank off the coast of Kerala. While all the 24 crew members were rescued, some of the ship’s containers with hazardous cargo have either gone down with the vessel or have washed ashore. While the world worries about environmental pollution from this particular incident, John L. Paul finds that the fisher folk are more concerned about indiscriminate mining and the dumping of untreated pollutants

title: Rediscovery of the Losgna genus in India: a new species of parasitic wasp discovered in Chandigarh, named - ‘Losgna Occidentalis’
content: The rediscovery of the Losgna genus in India, after close to six decades, and describes “a new species collected from an urban dry scrub forest in Chandigarh”

content: The Minister also announced that the party would stand in support of the bereaved family even for its future requirements

title: Haryana IMA seeks clarity on State govt.’s cashless treatment scheme for accident victims
content: Under the scheme, the road accident victims would be administered cashless emergency care of up to ₹1.5 lakh with a cap of maximum of seven days

title: Kidney transplant in Tamil Nadu sets record for shortest wait time
content: At a press briefing, experts and the kidney transplant recipient highlighted the need for clinical excellence, affordable care, and equitable access in transplant services

title: Stalin says Ministry of Home Affairs’ remarks on delimitation are ‘vague’
content: The Chief Minister asserts that if delimitation is carried out based on the Census 2027, democratic power of peninsular India will be reduced to irrelevance. He also calls for a clear Parliamentary commitment

title: Hyderabad in fragments: a city’s story told in micro-histories
content: In his new book, author Daneesh Majid pieces together a mosaic of lives altered by Operation Polo, migration and memory, offering a people’s history of a city often defined by dynasties and politics

title: How ocean science is feeding coastal India
content: The ocean is vast, but fishermen no longer have to guess, thanks to INCOIS’ Potential Fishing Zone advisories generated from ocean data and high-resolution satellite imagery. Catches are up, fuel use is down and incomes are rising, proving that precision fishing is not just possible, but profitable too

title: Influencer Sharmistha Panoli walks out of Alipore Jail in hate speech case
content: The 22-year-old was granted bail by the Calcutta High Court on Thursday and released on Friday afternoon

title: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme labour budget cut to 12 crore person-days in Tamil Nadu
content: During 2024-25 too, the State was allotted only 20 crore person-days. Later, the Centre approved around 10 crore more person-days

title: State public health lab develops molecular tests to identify deadly amoeba
content: This is the first  time that the lab has managed to identify and give confirmatory diagnosis of the causative organism of amoebic encephalitis in a human sample using molecular  diagnostic tests developed in its own lab. The lab has developed tests to identify five species of amoeba which are commonly found to cause serious disease in humans

title: Govt. inks pact with NVIDIA on establishment of AI University in Andhra Pradesh

title: Experience life by Odisha’s Chilika Lake at the Rambha Palace, a boutique hotel with European aesthetics
content: Rambha Palace, a 200-year-old historical structure at Ganjam in Odisha is now a boutique hotel. We walk through its carpeted floors and sprawling lawns, visit local fish markets and interact with bamboo artisans to experience the best of Odia culture

title: Suspension of police commissioner rankles police establishment
content: ‘There was not even a preliminary inquiry which found a prima facie lapse. How could a commissioner be suspended like this?’

content: After almost a year in office, Mohan Majhi, the head of Odisha’s first BJP government, says the “larger vision” is to make Odisha a “developed and prosperous” State. He says the government is making up for “lost time” and is proactive in “putting Odisha among the top five industrial States”

title: Kamal Haasan, DMK and AIADMK candidates file nominations for Rajya Sabha election
content: The last day of filing nominations is June 9). Any nominations received will be taken up for scrutiny the following day. The last day for withdrawal of nominations, if any, is June 12.
